documentType: system access form and security policy
summary: This document is a Department of Justice MEGA4 Automated Litigation Support System Account Request and Approval Form for the case 'US v. Epstein', followed by the DOJ's Information Technology Security Rules of Behavior for General Users. It establishes the procedural framework for granting system access to personnel working on the Epstein case and outlines their security responsibilities.
keyFacts: The document is an account request form for the DOJ's MEGA4 litigation support system, specifically for the case 'US v. Epstein' (DARQ DJ NUMBER: 2442-0129).
It includes the DOJ's standard IT Security Rules of Behavior (Version 7.0, dated January 3, 2014), which all users must acknowledge.
The form requires approval for system access, indicating controlled information management for the Epstein case.
The document itself does not contain the names of specific individuals involved in the case; the user fields (FULL NAME, SECTION, etc.) on the form are blank in this copy.
The security rules emphasize protecting Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and outline penalties for unauthorized disclosure, including fines and imprisonment.
